 To run the pre-commit checks locally, you can follow below steps: 1. Ensure that default python is python3. In sonic-mgmt docker container, default python is python2. You can run the check by activating the python3 virtual environment in sonic-mgmt docker container or outside of sonic-mgmt docker container. 2. Ensure that the `pre-commit` package is installed: ``` sudo pip install pre-commit ``` 3. Go to repository root folder 4. Install the pre-commit hooks: ``` pre-commit install ``` 5. Use pre-commit to check staged file: ``` pre-commit ``` 6. Alternatively, you can check committed files using: ``` pre-commit run --from-ref --to-ref ```

LGTM.. however what is the best way to get auto-neg capability for eos that does not support json o/p ?

> LGTM.. however what is the best way to get auto-neg capability for eos that does not support json o/p ?
I think we need to investigate more on that one.

@arlakshm the original command test use to retrieve autoneg state is `show int eth 1/1 status | json`. If it does not work in EOS version you have, please try to add an alternative way using the command 'show interfaces ethernet <int_name> negotiation'. My output is below:
```
fanout#show interfaces ethernet 1/1 negotiation
Port Autoneg Negotiated Settings
 Status Speed Lanes Duplex Rx Pause Tx Pause FEC
---------- ------- ----- ----- ------ -------- -------- ----
Et1/1 off - - - - - -
```

@siqbal1986 , pls check.
the description and change are contradictory. the change is disabling the platform and the description states it's enabling it.
@siqbal1986 , the check is "platform not in the list". The change is adding cisco 8101-32FH to the list.
@myronsosyak please review

Hi @yutongzhang-microsoft , duplicate keys (test cases) in condition mark would cause the previous condition to be invalid (in this PR, line806-810). So I updated it by https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/pull/7241.
The change is already in 202205. No cherry-pick is required. I direct added lable "Included in 202205 branch".
@zjswhhh do we need to cherry-pick this change to 202012 branch as well?

> @zjswhhh do we need to cherry-pick this change to 202012 branch as well?

No need for 202012 or 202205, the PR introducing the issue wasn't picked into these two branches. This test is only failing on master/internal branch.
Hi @StormLiangMS, I added label for 202211 branch for https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-buildimage/pull/13264, this should be fixed when merged.

@ZhaohuiS removed all xfails per your previous review comment in latest commit.

Were these changes verified to on 202205 ? We are observing that the drop_packets tests are now failing in 202205 and we don't see the counters being supported in the SAI 7.1 codebase which is used in 202205.

> 

@kartik-arista - SAI support for all the drop counters that were enabled in this PR, has been there since version 7.1.25.4. 202205 is currently at 7.1.36.4. These tests were validated on DNX-based platform and have been routinely passing nightly tests on DNX platforms.
Thanks, @tjchadaga - we will follow up with Broadcom. Note that we are observing the failures on a modular VOQ chassis with the T2 topology.

@vaibhavhd for awareness.

@congh-nvidia from the attached log, it appears that 30 minutes expired on a backtrace of setting up the test. In this case, why would adding another 5 minutes help?
Holding off back port until we have understood the change.

> @vaibhavhd for awareness.
> 
> @congh-nvidia from the attached log, it appears that 30 minutes expired on a backtrace of setting up the test. In this case, why would adding another 5 minutes help?

This is not the setup phase of the test but the teardown phase. The sad_setup() is called in revert() to revert the setup to the pre-test state.
The initial caller handle_post_reboot_test_reports() is in the finally block of the test(line 1283):
https://github.com/sonic-net/sonic-mgmt/blob/c2a86d2e9d037d1be3d8c744915a06d9b0ab3547/ansible/roles/test/files/ptftests/advanced-reboot.py#L1227-L1283
Thanks for the clarification! Putting back the cherry-picking flag.
@abdosi created a new PR to skip both the q100 platforms.
@abdosi could you please help merging this PR.
Hi @ihorchekh! TC allows setting a number of sub-interfaces by using `--max_numbers_of_sub_ports` parameter. May be better to use this for changing the number of sub-interfaces for specific cases.

> Hi @ihorchekh! TC allows setting a number of sub-interfaces by using `--max_numbers_of_sub_ports` parameter. May be better to use this for changing the number of sub-interfaces for specific cases.

Yes, you're right, it would be better, but from our side it will cause a lot of problems, because our infra is built to run a group of different devices in the same automation scenario and we will need to make a lot of sophisticated changes for this exception. So, adding the condition in this PR is reasonable.

@wangxin Can you please help to backport this PR to 202205 branch? This will fix the testcase failure on Arista-720dt.

Thanks for addressing the gap. I think there is another GAP in CPA scenario - we verify only ARP handling for IPv4 neighbors. However, no verification is done for neighbor-discovery packets for IPv6 neighbors.

That should be taken into consideration as part of new gap, and new PR. Just calling it out for future work.

@jcaiMR can you update the PR title to make it more meaningful?

> I also have same question as Storm. The test gap mentions a few more asks on verification. Where are below cases being verified?
> 
> 1. L2 forwarded traffic is NOT broadcasted when the MAC is learnt?
> 2. Mirroring of traffic happens for the entire duration -- CPA creation to CPA removal? This PR checks for increment of ACL counter. However, this still not verifies if the mirroring happened for the entire duration of CPA existence.

@jcaiMR can you also address these questions? Thanks!

> > I also have same question as Storm. The test gap mentions a few more asks on verification. Where are below cases being verified?
> > 
> > 1. L2 forwarded traffic is NOT broadcasted when the MAC is learnt?
> > 2. Mirroring of traffic happens for the entire duration -- CPA creation to CPA removal? This PR checks for increment of ACL counter. However, this still not verifies if the mirroring happened for the entire duration of CPA existence.
> 
> @jcaiMR can you also address these questions? Thanks!

Sorry Vaibhav, I may missed some comments.

1. layer2 not broadcast by PTF side verify Arp reply come from same port as we send Arp request. If ARP reply broadcasted, packet verify will failure. Like previous dual-tor issue in static route scripts, with wrong mac packet broadcasted and packet verify failure. Related diff is here:
```
 testutils.send_packet(self, port, pkt)
 # check arp reply should come from same port
 # clean arp, test broadcast reply if needed
 testutils.verify_packet_any_port(self, exp_pkt, ports=[port])
```

2. the test method here is:
Waiting for CPA create ferret everflow table -> start to send arp request -> verify everflow acl increase (This verify arp request send out through mirror)

For ARP reply, I plan to use folowing logic:

vxlan table created -> ptf received arp reply -> verify vxlan rx ounter increase 

But after sync with Prince Sunny and also based on my testing result, currently we don't have way to verify vxlan decap packets (On some platform it does not support vxlan decap packets counting). In PR we just check vxlan table created. So at this moment we can't fully verify ferret downlink stream.

> > > I also have same question as Storm. The test gap mentions a few more asks on verification. Where are below cases being verified?
> > > 
> > > 1. L2 forwarded traffic is NOT broadcasted when the MAC is learnt?
> > > 2. Mirroring of traffic happens for the entire duration -- CPA creation to CPA removal? This PR checks for increment of ACL counter. However, this still not verifies if the mirroring happened for the entire duration of CPA existence.
> > 
> > 
> > @jcaiMR can you also address these questions? Thanks!
> 
> Sorry Vaibhav, I may missed some comments.
> 
> 1. layer2 not broadcast by PTF side verify Arp reply come from same port as we send Arp request. If ARP reply broadcasted, packet verify will failure. Like previous dual-tor issue in static route scripts, with wrong mac packet broadcasted and packet verify failure. Related diff is here:
> 
> ```
> testutils.send_packet(self, port, pkt)
> # check arp reply should come from same port
> # clean arp, test broadcast reply if needed
> testutils.verify_packet_any_port(self, exp_pkt, ports=[port])
> ```
> 
> 2. the test method here is:
> Waiting for CPA create ferret everflow table -> start to send arp request -> verify everflow acl increase (This verify arp request send out through mirror)
> 
> For ARP reply, I plan to use folowing logic:
> 
> vxlan table created -> ptf received arp reply -> verify vxlan rx ounter increase
> 
> But after sync with Prince Sunny and also based on my testing result, currently we don't have way to verify vxlan decap packets (On some platform it does not support vxlan decap packets counting). In PR we just check vxlan table created. So at this moment we can't fully verify ferret downlink stream.


For 2nd item -- I understand the check for ARP req and limitation for ARP reply. But, I think the ask in the gap is that this verification of req/reply is done for entire duration of the CPA tunnel.

In other words, the change here will PASS the testcase if CPA functionality worked at least once. However, the ask is to verify if CPA mirroring works for the entire duration of tunnel's existence.

This would be a little complicated check, where mirroring starts when CPA is ready, and ends when CPA is teardown. I think that will require timing verification.
We could address the remaining items in the test gap in future PR, and proceed with what we have in this PR. The changes here are good on their own, just that we can't close the test gap issue yet.

In PR we just check vxlan table created. So at this moment we can't fully verify ferret downlink stream.

I see, so the case is like everflow created first, and destroyed before warmup finished. Do we have any flag can be watched to see if control plan is still working on warm reboot procedual ? Then we can change the loop check logic to fit all warm reboot lifetime.
